title: paid2
author: paid2
created_time: November 19, 2023, 02:37:11 PMLast edit: November 19, 2023, 04:52:27 PM by iwantmyhomepaidwithbtc2
content: Hi there!Someone kindly offered me the paper version of the book Mastering Bitcoin translated into my native language. Since I already own an English version of this book, and I don't like having things lying around unnecessarily, I thought I'd organize a little raffle and give it away for free to someone on the forum.The book is free (please note that the book is not new).Shipping is free within the European Union.Shipping anywhere else would be at your expense, in the case of the US or Asia I think you would lose money compared to the value of the book.Unfortunately, I cannot ship it to Russia, Ukraine, Kosovo or Serbia.Information about the book: Mastering Bitcoin, 2nd Edition, written by  Andreas M. Antonopoulos, June 2017If some of you don't know, you can find this book for free here, it's a must read: https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbookRules:There are 6 spots and we'll do the draw with Bitmover's tool to make it fair and transparent: https://bitcoindata.science/giveaway-manager/Only Bitcointalk accounts registered before the 1st September 2023.List of participants:Code:1 - bitbollo2 - Gazeta3 - StackItUp 4 - Remsjack5 - krogoth6 - aoluain

comments.author: BABY SHOES
comments.body: I actually wanted to join this raffle, but considering the cost of going to Asia would be very expensive, I decided against it. By the way, is this collection raffle more appropriate on this board? CollectiblesConsidering this is a board for contests or giveaways with BTC? Sorry if I'm wrong.

comments.author: paid2
comments.body: Quote from: BABY SHOES on November 19, 2023, 03:34:47 PMI actually wanted to join this raffle, but considering the cost of going to Asia would be very expensive, I decided against it. Feel free to PM me your country and a city. I can check and give you an idea of the shipment priceQuote from: BABY SHOES on November 19, 2023, 03:34:47 PMBy the way, is this collection raffle more appropriate on this board? CollectiblesConsidering this is a board for contests or giveaways with BTC? Sorry if I'm wrong.Thank you, makes sense. Moving the topic right now

comments.author: aoluain
comments.body: Thank you to the OP, I'll take #66. aoluain

comments.author: paid2
comments.body: List updated  Let's go with block #817530You can check the list / the draw via this linkGood luck guys  Edit : krogoth I've kept you on the list, considering the number of raffles you offer to the forum, I'll pay the shipping costs for you wherever you are.
